Description: 'Madonna del Rosario'; the Virgin and Christ Child standing on a crescent at centre, both holding rosaries, encircled by a rosary and angels, below, St Francis of Assisi at left with St Paul the Hermit , St Jerome and St Antony at right Pen and brown ink, with grey-brown wash
Curator's comments: Not in Popham. Eduardo Batarda Fernandes (May 2021): 'The saint on the left, behind St. Francis, is St. Paul the Hermit. This is confirmed by his clothes, the pair of lions digging his grave and the association with St. Anthony the Great'.
Bibliographic references: Phillipps-Fenwick 1935 / Catalogue of drawings in the collection of T Fitzroy Phillipps-Fenwick (p.206(6))
Associated names: Representation of: St Francis of Assisi
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Representation of: St Paul the Hermit
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Samuel Woodburn (Christie's, 7.vi.1860/661 as 'Various drawings of the Italian school - Others by Baroccio, Baglioni, S. Conca &c.', 12 in the lot, bt by Phillipps £1-1-0)
